cause.description:
The Go Green At School initiative is a simple, comprehensive program designed to create a culture of environmental responsibility on higher education (community colleges, colleges, universities, etc.) campuses across the nation. We want to unite students, professors, and school administrators in an effort to make real and lasting changes in their campus communities that will assist in protecting the environment.
This initiative falls under the authority and auspicious of the "Go Green Initiative" which was founded in 2002.
1. There is not enough proactive recycling on campuses of higher education.
2. People will do the right thing when given trustworthy information, expert training and simple tools.
3. People (even students) appreciate a program like the Go Green At School, which provides a framework for success, many options and the freedom to choose the options that work best for them.
cause.mission: To promote recycling at higher education institutions across the nation by heightening awareness and promote participation in environmentally responsible behavior.
cause.name: Go Green At School
